messages: 0890cb2c97add87411ed7ff48f6ddb92 (03:18): hummm, a bit ot, but anybody know a free winbloze xp tool for formatting a fat32 partition?
9c98af909f1130c4e56eda05bbfca225 (03:20): besides just using windows to format it?

dca9ec0c99a0aa98d2450ebc9f941f10 (03:28): I have an ad-hoc wireless setup. My desktop is connected to the internet via my ethernet lan.. I share the connection with my laptop via my desktop's wifi card. Both are WinXP. Every few minutes, the wifi starts searching/scanning and drops until it reconnects... any ideas?
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (03:33): rigelf uhh windows?
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (03:33): what are you trying to do
0890cb2c97add87411ed7ff48f6ddb92 (03:49): flyback: format a patition.. what is unclear about that? windoze offers only ntfs
9c98af909f1130c4e56eda05bbfca225 (03:50): um, windows lets you format fat32 last I checked
9c98af909f1130c4e56eda05bbfca225 (03:53): rigelf: Yeah... it still lets you format partitions as fat32.
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (03:59): why are you using fat32
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (03:59): there is a reason they only offer ntfs
0890cb2c97add87411ed7ff48f6ddb92 (04:12): there must be something wrong with my windzoe
0890cb2c97add87411ed7ff48f6ddb92 (04:12): windoze?
0890cb2c97add87411ed7ff48f6ddb92 (04:12): i cannot write to ntfs with linux
0890cb2c97add87411ed7ff48f6ddb92 (04:12): i would like to share a partition between the two operating systems
9c98af909f1130c4e56eda05bbfca225 (04:12): If you're going to intentially spell windows wrong, at least misspell it correctly =)
9c98af909f1130c4e56eda05bbfca225 (04:14): Well, if you're running x86, there's a method for read/write to ntfs right now that seems stable enough
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (04:14): rigelf
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (04:14): 2k/xp will let you format a fat32 partition up to 32 gig
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (04:15): it just won't let you do more because it sucks
9c98af909f1130c4e56eda05bbfca225 (04:15): rigelf: running x86 linux?
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (04:15): fat32 sucks ass for large filesystems
92a2971947f98559b55851639c206ff3 (04:37): what's the diff between Celeron D processors of type 326,331,336, etc
0890cb2c97add87411ed7ff48f6ddb92 (04:58): the partition is 340 gb... fuck this.. i'll find mformat on a livecd
92a2971947f98559b55851639c206ff3 (05:00): can a computer that accepts a sempron CPU accept a sempron 64-bit CPU?
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (05:00): if it was a sempron 64 limited to 32
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (05:01): socket 754
92a2971947f98559b55851639c206ff3 (05:01): So it will just run as 32-bit cpu? Yes, socket 754 is what I'm looking at.
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (05:01): well no see
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (05:02): they had some socket 754 sempron's that were capped to 32 bit only
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (05:02): for vendor reasons
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (05:02): idiot hp etc
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (05:02): thought their customers would be confused
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (05:02): aka intel threatened them
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (05:02): but you can swap out that 32 bit only socket 754 sempron for a 64 bit one
9c98af909f1130c4e56eda05bbfca225 (05:04): If it's a 754 board, it'll run 64-bit with a 64-bit sempron
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (05:04): yep
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (05:04): bbl
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (05:04): going out
92a2971947f98559b55851639c206ff3 (05:04): Ok, sounds good. Wierd differentiation.
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (05:04): it's been a hard day, I had to abandon a project and I feel bad
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (05:04): even though transfering the project to someone else so the party doesn't get screwed
4adfe5089bef9fb50fa01ef8cdaadfad (05:18): heh
